result.execSummary:
The defendant Eliseo Antonio Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Full Huber. Stayed-Defendant to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm within 72 working hours or by 10/12/2022 for report date within 60 days or no later than 12/09/2022. Failure to do so will result in issuance of a commitment to jail without huber privileges and new criminal charges.
Concurrent with: 22CM392

11:00 AM Defendant Eliseo Antonio Ramirez in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Eliseo Antonio Ramirez.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest. Court finds the defendant guilty and orders 30 days jail with full Huber.
